page.title: 19MONMOUTHSHIRE_BRECON CANAL
page.content: Raw materials for the many ironworks in the locality necessitated a cheap capable transport system to them.To meet this need an Act of Parliament in 1792 allowed the construction of the canal system from Pontnewynydd to Newport to transport iron and later steel to Newport for distribution home and abroad.The connection to the Monmouthshire_Brecon canal allowed wider availability of timber,ore, limestone and coal,all necessary to the iron and steel processes.Limestone was also distributed for fertilising farmland. Nowdays we enjoy the canal for its motorcruising,canoeing,wildlife and fishing.The towpaths provide long walks through beautiful countryside away from the hustle and bustle of modern life.
